utils package¶

CustomLoggerFormatter module¶

class src.utils.CustomLoggerFormatter.CustomFormatter(fmt)¶

Bases: Formatter

Logging colored formatter, adapted from https://stackoverflow.com/a/56944256/3638629

blue = '\x1b[38;5;39m'¶
bold_red = '\x1b[31;1m'¶
format(record)¶

Format the specified record as text.

The record’s attribute dictionary is used as the operand to a string formatting operation which yields the returned string. Before formatting the dictionary, a couple of preparatory steps are carried out. The message attribute of the record is computed using LogRecord.getMessage(). If the formatting string uses the time (as determined by a call to usesTime(), formatTime() is called to format the event time. If there is exception information, it is formatted using formatException() and appended to the message.

grey = '\x1b[38;21m'¶
red = '\x1b[38;5;196m'¶
reset = '\x1b[0m'¶
yellow = '\x1b[38;5;226m'¶

actionQ module¶

class src.utils.actionQ.ActionQ¶

Bases: object

Manages the action queue for various tasks and functionalities.

The idea of the action queue is to assemble the complex list of actions that need to be executed beforehand. This provides a big picture view and a simple main function that simply steps through the queue.

assembleQ()¶

Assembles the initial action queue based on provided arguments.

assembleQ_for_runs(action)¶

Assembles an action queue for a given action.

The action will be performed multiple times according to the number of runs command line parameter and different attributes on the emulator will be measured Usually the action will be a Player object, meaning the recorded inputs of the user are replayed and investigated.

Those actions will not yet be performed, just queued.

Parameters:

action (Functionality) – The action to be performed and investigated.

do_next()¶

Executes the next action in the queue.

finished = False¶
get_data()¶

Collects and returns data from the action queue.

Returns:

Collected data in JSON format.

Return type:

str

get_pretty_print()¶

Returns a pretty-printed string of the results from the data gatherers.

Returns:

Pretty-printed results.

Return type:

str

index = 0¶
logger = 'actionQ'¶

This allows screenshots to be labeled with the current action

apk_downloader module¶

class src.utils.apk_downloader.ApkDownloader¶

Bases: object

Handles APK downloading and installation from apksfull.com.

Attributes:

base_url (str): Base URL for the APK site. version_url (str): URL for fetching APK versions. download_url (str): URL for downloading APKs. search_url (str): URL for searching APKs. logger (Logger): Logger instance for APKDownloader operations. headers (dict): HTTP headers for requests.

exception src.utils.ccl_abx.AbxDecodeError¶

Bases: Exception

class src.utils.ccl_abx.AbxReader(stream: BinaryIO)¶

Bases: object

MAGIC = b'ABX\x00'¶
read(*, is_multi_root=False)¶

Read the ABX file :param is_multi_root: some xml files on Android contain multiple root elements making reading them using a document model problematic. For these files, set is_multi_root to True and the output ElementTree will wrap the elements in a single “root” element. :return: ElementTree representation of the data.

file_diff module¶

src.utils.file_diff.abx_xml_diff(xml_file, dir1, dir2)¶

Calculates the differences between two ABX XML files.

Parameters:

  • xml_file (str) – The name of the XML file to compare.

  • dir1 (str) – The directory of the first XML version.

  • dir2 (str) – The directory of the second XML version.

Returns:

A formatted string naming entries that have been added and removed.

Return type:

str

Returns:

frida_manager module¶

class src.utils.frida_manager.FridaManager(logger=None, is_remote=False, socket='', verbose=False, frida_install_dst='/data/local/tmp/')¶

Bases: object

adb_check_root()¶
download_frida_server(path, version='latest')¶

Downloads a frida server. By default the latest version is used. If you want to download a specific version you have to provide it trough the version parameter.

Parameters:

  • path – The path where the compressed frida-server should be downloded.

  • version – The version. By default the latest version will be used.

Returns:

The location of the downloaded frida server in its compressed form.

Return type:

string

extract_frida_server_comp(file_path)¶
get_frida_server_for_android_url(version)¶
install_frida_server(dst_dir='/data/local/tmp/', version='latest')¶

Install the frida server binary on the Android device. This includes downloading the frida-server, decompress it and pushing it to the Android device. By default it is pushed into the /data/local/tmp/ directory. Further the binary will be set to executable in order to run it.

Parameters:

  • dst_dir – The destination folder where the frida-server binary should be installed (pushed).

  • version – The version. By default the latest version will be used.

is_frida_server_running()¶

Checks if on the connected device a frida server is running. The test is done by the Android system command pidof and is looking for the string frida-server.

Returns:

True if a frida-server is running otherwise False.

Return type:

bool

make_frida_server_executable(frida_server_path='/data/tmp/local/tmp/')¶
remove_frida_server(frida_server_path='/data/local/tmp/')¶
run_adb_command_as_root(command)¶
run_frida_server(frida_server_path='/data/local/tmp/')¶

This function is used to run the frida server on the connected device.

Parameters:

frida_server_path (str) – The path where the frida server is located. Default is “/data/local/tmp/”.

Returns:

True if the frida server started successfully, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

stop_frida_server()¶

pdf_report module¶

Adapted From https://github.com/jurasec/python-reportlab-example

class src.utils.pdf_report.FooterCanvas(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: Canvas

draw_canvas(page_count)¶
save()¶

Saves and close the PDF document in the file. If there is current data a ShowPage is executed automatically. After this operation the canvas must not be used further.

showPage()¶

Close the current page and possibly start on a new page.

timeline_generator module¶

src.utils.timeline_generator.create_timeline(events, filename, duration)¶

Create a timeline plot with custom colors for different event types.

Parameters:

  • events – A list of tuples where each tuple contains the event type, timestamp, and description.

  • filename – The name of the PNG file to save the timeline to.

  • duration – Duration of one of the actions
